content:
Sorry, I was waiting for you to ask if--
if I needed anything.

So, this is my mom
and dad's favorite restaurant

and Friday's
their 35th wedding anniversary, Jade.
How do you know my name?

Oh, I don't. That's what
the 35th wedding anniversary is:

Oh, 7:30, three people and really wanna
make sure we get the window table.
I have to talk to Derrick.

Do you mind just turning that up?
Thank you.

Roy, your old mob in Richmond,
uh, struggling.

There are a lot of theories
as to why that might be.

One that's gaining traction
is a lack of leadership

from your successor as captain,
Isaac McAdoo.
Isaac's a good lad. He'll find his way.
You know, under Ted Lasso, Richmond, well,

they're like a woman behind the wheel:
completely lost!

George! Didn't you lose your license
drink driving?

That was an allergic reaction
to my medication.

The same medication
that made you piss your pants?

We can set aside
the table in the corner for you.

I would really like the window table,
you know, just to impress my dad.

I'm sorry. I can't guarantee a reservation
for the window table.
I know Roy Kent, if that's--

Well, please let us know
if Mr. Kent ever wants the window table.
{\an9}Improved Captions by Sailor420 !!! Hope you enjoy the Series!!!
Yes, that goal was entirely my fault.

I don't wanna hear it.
We need to get our shit together!

Hey, hit pause for me, will you?
Hey, fellas.

- (blows)
- No, I gave you an indoor whistle.
Listen, I don't care what our record is,

but I hear the chatter, people saying
there's something wrong with us.
Not the way I see it, okay?

Well, Bumbercatch,
it is a worldview that reminds us

that romantic comedies with folks
like Tom Hanks, Meg Ryan or, uh,

Julia Roberts and Hugh Grant or--
Who am I missing, Coach?

- Matthew McConaughey, obviously.
- All right, all right. Yeah.

- The three Kates.
- Yeah, Beckinsale, Hudson, Winslet.

I enjoy Renée Zellweger
and all the Bridget Jones movies.

- Mmm.
- I mean, her accent is pitch perfect

and her gift of physical comedy
is grossly underrated.

All right,
you've gotta give it up for Zellweger.

Look, point is, fellas,
if all those attractive people

with their amazing apartments
and interesting jobs,

can go through some lighthearted struggles
and still end up happy,

That's a great call, Dani,
and not at all a beat too late.

is all about believing that everything's
gonna work out in the end.
Now these next few months might be tricky,

but that's just 'cause
we're going through our dark forest.

Fairy tales do not start,
nor do they end in the dark forest.

That son of a gun always shows up
smack-dab in the middle of a story.
But it will all work out.
Now, it may not work out

how you think it will
or how you hope it does,
but believe me, it will all work out.

Our job is to have zero expectations
and just let go.
We need to stop playing like shit!

Yeah, not exactly what I said,
but I appreciate you, Isaac.

Okay, let's watch the second half.
Come on, Coach.

Hey, anyone know
what's going on with Isaac?

I've accepted "aubergine" and "snogging",
but "piles" I will not abide.

Wait a second,
we play Sheffield Wednesday?

- Saturday.
- Oh, we're playing Sheffield Saturday?
We gotta play 'em twice in the same week?

(inhales deeply)
The club is called Sheffield Wednesday.

They're called Sheffield Wednesday because
they used to only play on Wednesdays.

But nowadays they play
on whatever day they feel like,
including, but not limited to, Saturdays,

which, again, is the day
we will be playing them.
This Saturday? I can't. I got plans.

Good afternoon.
Coach Lasso, is Isaac okay?
Nah, he's a wigwam in a tepee right now.
He's wound tighter than my nan's hairnet.
That only makes sense if you know my nan,

but when she wears a hairnet it looks
like puppies are trying to escape from it.

- Do you want me to talk to Isaac?
- No. That's okay. We got it.

I know exactly what Isaac needs.
Thank you, though.

- What does Isaac need?
- Oh, I have no idea.

I'd have a player talk to the team captain
before I intervened.

And I can't very well
ask Isaac to pull himself aside.

'Cause that would be dangerously close
to messing with the, what's it?

- Oh.
- Fact is, Isaac is a big dog, you know?

So he's only going to
respond to a big dog himself.

- You knew he was being serious?
- Yeah, man.
Um, I'm sorry about that, Nate.
But I do appreciate the offer, you know?
I think we gotta get him a real big dog.

And now you're doubling down
as Shy Rebecca,

She does not actually exist,
so something's up.

Come get your free
Nespresso coffee machines
because I'm amazing at my job!

People who are amazing at their job
don't have to point it out.

Actually, that's not how it works anymore.
It's all about promoting your own brand.

Oi! Please don't forget to post
when you make yourselves an Americano.

I'll put something
on my Insta straightaway.

Do you think you can make this one post
not about Welsh independence?

So can I, like, give this back to you
and you give me cash?

- Is that a thing, or…
- No.

Sorry. It's just this mystery man
that I've been talking to on Bantr

"Our deepest fears are like dragons
guarding our deepest treasures".

Maybe you're writing letters
to a hung poet.
Is that a joke from Sex and The City?
I love that you're so excited.

That's so Bantr,
a place where minds can come to undress.
That's really good. I'm gonna use that.
I mean, don't get me wrong,

I'm still chatting to these other guys
on the other dating app, Tumescent.
Yeah, and what was that discourse like?
Jesus, where's the rest of it?

I mean, shouldn't romance
have a little mystery to it?
Sure, it depends on what you want.

It all comes back to branding,
even with love.
Oh, Dani! Enjoy your free coffee.

Oh, I don't drink coffee.
My mother says I was born caffeinated.
Is it okay if I give it to my neighbor?

She also doesn't drink coffee
but her son does.

And she's trying to encourage
more visits from him.

- Oh, wow. Look at this.
- Sorry, Nate.
They're actually just for the players.

Oh, I hate free coffee anyway,
always tastes so, um…
What can I help you with?
Um, we have an inquiry from AFC Wrexham.
Just got a call from their new owners,

showbiz magnates Rob McElhenney
and Ryan Reynolds.

I can't tell if them buying the club
is a joke or not,
so I haven't replied to them yet.

Right.
Did you just see what was on my screen?

I never look over anyone's shoulders
to see what's on their screens.
♫ "She's a Rainbow" playing on cell phone ♫ -Oh, apologies!

Uh, I'll ring her back later.
Keeps it fresh.

But I'll just text her real quick
to let her know that.

So your ringtone for your wife is
"She's a Rainbow" by the Rolling Stones?
It was playing the moment we met.

And, uh, it's not an exaggeration.
She really is my rainbow.
It is so odd to imagine you young.
Yeah, I get that a lot.

I was the only kid in primary school
with sciatica.
I had a gelatinous L4 and five.
Leslie, do you mind me asking,
when you first met your wife,
how did you put yourself across?
You know, what was your brand?
Well, you know, the night I met my wife,

I was attempting to be a brooding punk
with hair spiked out to here.

And then, uh, "She's a Rainbow" came on
and I started playing upright air bass

but I had a pint in my hand and ended up
pouring beer all over my head.

except one person who handed me
a damp, disgusting bar towel.
And I've been married to her for 29 years.

I suppose…
the best brand is just being yourself.
No, me? No, me? No, thank you. No, but--

Actually, there is possibly one thing
you might be able to help with.
No! Nate, you don't wanna be famous.

No!
There'll be photographers all up your bum.

Yeah,
and tabloids going through your rubbish.

Come on. You are who you are
because of who you are.

You don't wanna go messing around
with fame.

being famous seems to have
some perks though, right?
Famous people get sent so much free shit.

Lot of the time they don't figure out
what they want.

I know what I want.
A window table at a restaurant.

Well, that plus
maybe some of those groupies

No, obviously not.
That's, um, that's degrading.
Nathan needs a table at a restaurant.

No, er-- Um, it's, uh,
A Taste of Athens in T-Tooting.
Tooting. It's his parents' favorite place.

Well, it's the place
that my dad complains about the least.

Wait, you can't get a table
at something called "A Taste of Athens"

All right.
Well, there's a simple solution to that.
"You buy a man a table, he eats once.
You teach a man how to get a table

and he eats at that restaurant
until it becomes a Starbucks."

Oh, this is silly!
Nathan, just be assertive.

I told you, either you take down my photo
or you start giving me free kebabs.

after asking Keeley where you were
and scootin' my boot right over, that is.

a mustachioed surprise
that would anger me.

I thought it was gonna be Wario
or my great-aunt Natalie.

I don't know what makes
your aunt Natalie so great,

but I appreciate your effusiveness,
despite her appearance.

Why are you bothering me
at my kebab place?

- This is like my church.
- Oh?

Who knew transubstantiation
could happen with a pita? (chuckles)

What do you think
about joining the coaching staff?

Mmm, that's a solid negotiation tactic
right there.
I like what I'm doing, and I'm good at it.

People tweet about me,
with JIFs and everything.

I know some folks pronounce it "GIFs",
but I hear you.

Look,
if you enjoy doing the whole pundit thing,

then you should do it
for the rest of your life.
Why won't you let me be happy?

- Here you go, mate.
- Thank you.

- You two are father and son, right?
- What? No.
(waiter) Ah, it's all the same thing.

You two remind me
of me and my old man when I told him

I was leaving medical school
a week before graduation.
Ooh, I bet that's a story.
Would have made a great doctor too.
I was really good at it.

Bedside manner,
reading charts, cutting up shit.
But it's just not what I was meant to do.
What? I love making a doner kebab.
Anyway, how's that kebab, my friend?

Well, to quote Drizzy,
it's the best I ever had.
Look, Roy, all kibbles and bits aside,

I'm really just here to ask you
for a favor for an old friend.
Hmm. He's all up in his head, isn't he?

Yes, he is. And I need him
to check out of there by Saturday.
Let me finish my kebab and pray on it.
Well, this place is ruined now.
Hello, sir. Can I help you?

Uh, yes.
Um, Nathan Shelley, party of three.

Yes, Shelby.
Sorry, I should have said Shelby.

(imitates buzzer)
No. That is not your name.

It's Shelley, and you know it,
you dithering kestrel!

You don't need to be loud, Nathan.
You just need to be commanding.

With all due respect,
it's different for me, Miss Welton.
You command every room you walk into.

Have you ever been in a room
full of football club chairmen?

Every time I walk into
one of those meetings,

they look at me like some schoolgirl
with pigtails.

- Oh, you'd look well fit with pigtails.
- I do.
Before I go into the room,

I find somewhere private,
I stand up on my tiptoes,

put my arms in the air
and make myself as big as possible

It's a bit silly, but it works for me.
Find your own thing.

What the hell are we gonna do
with Roy anyway?

Same thing you do when you cross
an elephant with a rhinoceros,

Look, Roy just told me to bring you
to this address, ready to play.

I didn't press him for details.
You know how he gets.

- (scoffs) Fucking crabby, ain't he?
- Heck yeah.

Ain't no side-eye
like a Roy Kent side-eye.
Seriously, do you know where you're going?

Here, I'll just text him.
Let him know we're here.

- What? The shit one?
- That's where I grew up.

And during my career,
when I was going through a bad patch,
I'd come back here and play.

These are all the other fucks.
You're with them.
You what? You expect me to play with them?

I'm a professional, mate.
I'll fucking kill 'em.

- What about me? What do I get to do?
- Nothing.
Aw, come on. Can I keep score?
All right, I'm gonna use my fingers.

Hello. (clears throat)
Uh, Shelley, party of three.

In fact, that's all our names.
That's my dad there and my mum as well.

- A gaggle of Shelleys.
- Stop blabbing up the young lady.

- Your mother's hungry.
- Stop it, Lloyd.

- He's been wanting this saganaki all week.
- Ah.

Mmm, as you may remember,
it's their 35th wedding anniversary. Jade.

Sorry, uh, if you remember,
I requested the window table?

Sorry, we don't take reservations
for the window table.

Jade,
this is a special night for my parents,
and the window table is open.

So,
here is what I would love to see happen.
You're gonna give us that table,

and then my family
and I are gonna order a starter,

main course, little dessert,
a bottle of wine.

And you are going to be stunned
by how quickly a gaggle of Shelleys

can get through a three-course meal
and get out of here.

Perhaps you'd like to give me
your number as well?
Hey, Roy! Sure you don't wanna play?

You on one leg is better
than this fool on two.

- Ooh.
- (player) Take that, you little bitch.

Easy, mate. I think you hurt him.
Emotionally. (laughs)

What the fuck, Roy? Did you bring me
'round here to get my leg broke?

I brought you here to remind you
that football is a fucking game
that you used to play as a fucking kid.

even when you were getting
your fucking legs broken

fuck your overthinking,
fuck all that bullshit,

go back out there
and have some fucking fun.

Kinda like all the nipples
in that movie, Showgirls.
Halfway through, you don't even notice.

You just kinda get sucked
into the narrative.

- You gotta be kidding me.
- (players) Whoo!

Do you really think
I'm gonna fall for this shit?

You're trying to get me
to come back to the club and coach.

Excuse me, nil interest in making you
do something that ain't in your heart.
So, you're really not playing games?

but I came here tonight
'cause when you realize

you wanna spend the rest of your life
coaching with somebody,

you want the rest of your life
to begin ASAP.

I'm also just a coach,
standing in front of a boy,
I'm never coming back to Richmond.
Hey, I'm sorry about that, Coach.

- Set your alarm for p.m. instead of a.m.?
- Yes, sir, Steve Kerr. Thank you.

- Still, you got down here pretty quick.
- Yeah, well,

I think a fella should only take as long
as the tune "Easy Lover"

by Phil Collins and Philip Bailey
to get dressed in the morning.

Whoo! It is a beautiful Saturday,
and we are playing Sheffield Wednesday.
Hey, you never finished your joke.
What does a British owl say?
We had season tickets for Richmond.

I was a young punk
that snuck in every week.

My father wanted us
in the best seats in the house.
I sat there because she was there.
My mother and my boyfriend were furious.

They wanted to call security
to kick him out.
But she insisted that I should stay.

- And we fell in love.
- And we fell in love.
Years later, a close friend of the family

used the same story line
for the film Titanic.
And we've been in litigation ever since.

Tell him you own Richmond
and that you're fucking fit.

I was just checking in.
See how you're feeling.
Oh, well, that's mighty nice of you.

I-- I'm just dealing with the terror
of knowing what this world is about,

Watching a few good friends
screaming to let them out.
Well, my door is always open.

Heck, Coach Beard could take
that thing out for ya Jack Torrance style
That man has had many lives, many masters.

Oh, snap! Hottie alert.
Look at this guy. Whoo! Whoo! Whoo!
Game day suit. I love it.
What? Too much class? No such thing.

If you are out to describe the truth,
leave elegance to the tailor.

Hey, I appreciate you checking in, Doc.
All right. Let's go, Greyhounds! Whoo!
Let's round off the Premier League

with Arsenal heading
on the road to Newcastle,

where 17-year-old Matthew Kerr
will make his debut.

They're calling him the Irish Ronaldo.
What can we expect today?

Well, I think we can expect to see
a commanding performance from the lad.
Roy, what do you think he'll do today?

He'll probably have chips for dinner
and a wank before bed.

- (sighs)
- Roy, I was looking for some insight
I told you, I don't know.
All we do is sit around here

and guess what a bunch of little pricks
are gonna go and do out there,
then we come back at halftime,

and we complain 'cause they didn't do
exactly what we thought they'd do.
We're not in the locker rooms with them.
We're not on the pitch with them.

We can't look 'em in the eyes
and encourage them to be better

than they ever thought
they were capable of being.
We're just on the outside looking in.

Uh, well, here's a look at your old team
warming up in an interesting new way.
GEORGE: Look, it's all pretty loosey-goosey, isn't it?

that's at the business end
of the relegation zone.
KAMARA: But it's good to see McAdoo with a smile on his face.
He's been a shadow of himself all season.
I wonder what's gotten into him.

Oh, dang.
Yeah, come on, now. Come on, man.
Boom. Boom. Boom. Boom. Boom. Boom.
STELLING: Bloody cold out there today. Bet you don't miss that, Roy.
STELLING: Said, I bet you don't miss the cold, hey, Roy?

- What are you doing?
- I'm sorry, fellas.
This isn't what I'm meant to do.

- You're Roy Kent.
- No, I'm not.
All right, I am. Take me to Nelson Road.

It's me anniversary, mate,
and I haven't bought a present.

Sorry, mate,
this is as far as I can get ya.

I'll tell you the thing Nikki Sixx said
in the Mötley Crüe Behind the Music.

- "You gotta date your wife."
- Thanks, Roy.
Oi, you see this new watch?

You get me to Nelson Road
in ten minutes, it's yours.

- I've gotta get in there.
- Do you have a ticket?

- I can't let anyone in without a ticket.
- I'm Roy Kent.

- He does look like him.
- A little.

I believe you're holding a ticket
for Reba McEntire.
Good to see you back, Reba.

(crowd chanting) He's here! He's there!
He's every fucking where!

He's here! Here's there!
He's every fucking where!

- Really glad you decided to--
- Shut up.
